page.title: 02Community Life in Stoulton
page.content: People interviewed around Stoulton included the wife of the former sacristan of the village church. During her forty years there, she has experienced many changes including the construction of the main road to Drakes Broughton and the demise of the railway. People like the village because, although it is quiet, it is still linked to nearby towns by a regular bus service. The owner of the former village shop is now a handyman because the shop lost money and his family needed more accommodation. A lifelong villager had refused to permit demolition of her house to make way for the new road. Usually, she watches television for entertainment. Villages use the shops and other facilities of Pershore and Worcester.
